author: Caprice St. Pierre, The Canadian Press
title: Oilers back end looks sharp with addition of Walman, return of Ekholm
text:
EDMONTON ‚Äì With a series of trades, the return of an important player and some moves on the blue line, the Edmonton Oilers might have fixed their back end.
Tuesday‚Äôs 7-1 blowout over Utah Hockey Club showcased some depth scoring to counteract the end of Leon Draisaitl‚Äôs 18-game point streak, but also some stability on a blue line the Oilers have said they will need for the playoffs.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to get ahead of myself too early, but after the break we were rock bottom, we played terrible, we were getting outplayed tremendously,‚Äù said Oilers head coach Kris Knoblauch. ‚ÄúBut we‚Äôve been getting better and better and it started with our team defence and eliminating chances of the rush. And once you play better defensively, things will work better offensively.
Utah Hockey Club's Lawson Crouse (67) is stopped by Edmonton Oilers' goalie Calvin Pickard (30) as Jake Walman (96) defends during third period NHL action in Edmonton on Tuesday, March 18, 2025. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jason Franson ‚ÄúYou saw that (last) night. The way we were back checking, creating turnovers, countering. So we‚Äôve been getting better these past couple weeks, but certainly more room to go.‚Äù
The improved performance led to the suggestion that newly acquired defenceman Jake Walman, could be deployed right-side along Darnell Nurse, an idea he seems open to.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm comfortable with that. I think there‚Äôs opportunities that open up when you‚Äôre on your off-side,‚Äù added Walman, who‚Äôs a left-shot, traditionally left-side defenceman, but has embraced the expectations placed on him north of the border.
‚ÄúYou always want to be ready. There‚Äôs that standard here, you can feel it just when you walk into the room. I‚Äôm excited to be a part of it.‚Äù
The Oilers say they are ‚Äúexcited‚Äù to have him. Almost as much as Mattias Ekholm is excited to be back.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard to watch on TV. You want to be part of it. Especially during the stretch coming down here,‚Äù Ekholm said.
The left side defencemen returned from injury just in time to help propel the Oilers to open a four-game homestand with a win.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an exceptional penalty killer, so when he‚Äôs not there, that‚Äôs a huge whole,‚Äù Knoblauch said of Ekholm.
It‚Äôs not that Knoblauch feels the Oilers penalty kill struggled terribly without Ekholm, but the Swede left a big hole that needed some big shoes to fill.
Ekholm logged a goal and two assists in his ‚Äútransition‚Äù game against Utah, his first since returning from an illness and undisclosed lower-body injury sustained March 4 against the Anaheim Ducks. He also helped guide a defensively struggling Evan Bouchard, who had an assist, on the top defensive pairing.
That was the value the Oilers have felt Ekholm could bring to the lineup ‚Äî a guy that can direct players into the slot and manage the rest of the blue line.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs able to defend extremely well, but also get Leon (Draisaitl) and Connor (McDavid) on good breakout passes,‚Äù Knoblauch explained.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a guy that‚Äôs able to play other teams top units, as a shutdown guy. But able to also play with our top guys and be able to transfer the puck. He‚Äôs a not make a mistake kind of guy.‚Äù
Looking into what the Oilers hope is another long playoff stretch, a ‚Äúnot make a mistake guy‚Äù should be a key factor in leading the defence as the team looks to transitioning from a 3-3-0 start to March ‚Äî which included a loss to the lowly Buffalo Sabres ‚Äî into the team that now sits four points out of top spot in the Pacific Division.
‚ÄúThe six of us as a group, as we continue to get more and more chemistry and mesh, it‚Äôs really exciting to look at our back end and be a part of it,‚Äù Nurse said.
Nurse showed he could again a beast on the blue line after winning a fight against Jack McBain with seconds left and two goals up in the first period.
‚ÄúI was just hitting, nothing really (going on),‚Äù Nurse said.
There‚Äôs no guarantee that the rowdy performance will carry on, but it brings back some of that physicality Knoblauch has been talking about for weeks.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published March 19, 2025.

title: I've had more than 100 dangerous skin cancers removed since I was 16 - this is what I want every Australian to know this summer
text:
Lana Kelly got her first skin cancer diagnosis at 16 READ MORE: This fake tan doesn't stain your clothes or sheets after you put it on
A woman who has had more than 100 dangerous sun spots cut out of her skin is issuing a warning to Aussies about protecting their complexions under strong UV rays.
Lana Kelly, from Brisbane, got her first skin cancer diagnosis when she was just 16 after growing up on the Sunshine Coast with a lax approach to sun protection.
Since she had the cancer removed, the now-39-year-old has been hyper-vigilant when it comes to her skin and has regular checkups where almost every time something needs to be biopsied.
Lana told FEMAIL she has had over 100 moles, spots, carcinomas and early-stage melanomas surgically removed despite staying out of the sun and always wearing sunscreen.
Her cautious attitude to the sun coupled with her desire for golden skin saw her become a fake tanning addict which sparked a business idea. Lana launched a line of haircare products, Auriche, specifically for self tanners in December.
Lana Kelly, from Brisbane, got her first skin cancer diagnosis when she was just 16 after growing up on the Sunshine Coast with a lax approach to sun protection
Since her first skin cancer diagnosis, she has had more than 100 moles, spots carcinomas and early-stage melanomas surgically removed
Lara has her first skin cancer scare when she was 16 after she got two spots that had changed in appearance on her face checked out by her GP.
The spots were found to be cancerous and she had them removed leaving a ‚ÄòHarry Potter‚Äô scar on her right cheek.
‚ÄòWhen it‚Äôs cancerous they need to take quite a bit of tissue, it‚Äôs not just a simple cut,‚Äô she said.
‚ÄòThat was a pretty scary experience being so young and having to have that kind of surgery. It was very sobering.‚Äô
Thankfully, skin cancers caught early enough can be removed surgically and there is no need for further treatment.
Lana‚Äôs brush with skin cancer saw her become extra cautious when protecting herself from the sun but she wasn‚Äôt out of danger.
‚ÄòSince that age, I‚Äôve been going to the dermatologist definitely at least once a year but sometimes on three month cycle,‚Äô she said.
‚ÄòI don‚Äôt even know how many spots but I would have had probably a hundred cut off for biopsies and there were different types of cancer in (a number) of them.‚Äô
The now-39-year-old has been hyper vigilant when it comes to her skin and has regular check ups where almost every time something needs to be biopsied to check for cancer
Even though Lana has been to a dermatologist more times than she can count, she said waiting for biopsy results to determine if a suspicious spot was cancerous has never gotten easier.
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs nerve wracking each time. I think you don‚Äôt realise the stress until you get the text message saying it‚Äôs all fine or even to come back, at least you know,‚Äô she said.
‚ÄòI‚Äôve only had one very early stage melanoma but all of the other ones would have been problematic if I weren‚Äôt on top of them.‚Äô
Lana has become an expert in identifying when a freckle or mole has the potential to turn cancerous.
She said it‚Äôs important to monitor moles and spots for any change in appearance or colour or if one becomes red, itchy or looks irregular.
‚ÄòSometimes it‚Äôs just a weird feeling. Two weeks ago I had one cut off my collar bone. It looked stable, it hadn‚Äôt changed or anything but I kept finding myself drawn to and concerned about it,‚Äô she said.
Lana has become an expert in identifying is a spot has the potential to turn cancerous. She said to monitor any change in appearance or colour or if a spot becomes red or itchy
‚ÄòI went to see my dermatologist and in fact it was skin cancer. Over many years I‚Äôve become very aware of where my spots are and really keep an eye on them and take notice when things might feel off.‚Äô
The risk of skin cancer has plagued Lana‚Äôs immediate family, not because of genetics, but a lack of education around sun protection when she was a child.
Lana‚Äôs four sisters have had similar issues with two going through skin cancer treatments.
Their dad has also undergone chemotherapy, radiation and had a portion of his skull removed when a dangerous melanoma spread.
‚ÄòI‚Äôm always wearing hats and sunscreen and all of those sorts of things. Unfortunately for me though, the damage was done and locked in from a young age so it‚Äôs been years of seeing it manifest,‚Äô Lana said.
She and her sisters spent hours at the beach and in the sun as kids as their dad was a professional surfer but preventing sun burns was always an after thought.
‚ÄòMy parents were not super vigilant when it came to sun protection. They were quite young and the education around sun protection was not what it is today,‚Äô she said.
‚ÄòWe would be fairly regularly sunburnt before the age of seven. The damage done before the age of seven is really critical. It really sticks with you.‚Äô
Lana‚Äôs four sisters (pictured L-R: Lana, Nicolette Maxwell, Danika Maxwell and Talia O‚ÄôSullivan) have had similar issues with two going through skin cancer treatments
Lana and her sisters spent hours at the beach and in the sun as kids as their dad was a professional surfer but preventing sun burns was always an after thought
UV damage that happens during childhood has been strongly linked to an increased risk of skin cancer later in life according to Better Health.
As a result, Lana is always covered in sunscreen regardless of the weather and makes sure not to expose her skin to the sun if she can help it.
Her favourite go-to sunscreen is La Roche-Posay SPF 50 which she reapplies every two hours.
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs super light. I use that everywhere because it‚Äôs the kind of sunscreen where you don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre wearing anything. It‚Äôs in your handbag and it‚Äôs really easy to reapply,‚Äô she said.
Lana makes sure she gets up early before the UV levels peak to exercise or go to the beach where she uses invisible zinc as well as sun cream.
She also always wears a hat and clothes that cover her up as much as possible during the day and swears by linen for when the weather is hot.
Despite her efforts to stay away from the sun, Lana always wanted a glowing bronze complexion which lead to her ‚Äòaddiction‚Äô to fake tanning.
Despite her efforts to stay away from the sun, Lana always wanted a glowing bronze complexion which lead to her ‚Äòaddiction‚Äô to fake tanning
‚ÄòTanning is a religion for me,‚Äô she joked.
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a really nice way to feel better about my skin‚Ä¶My husband bought me a machine to do it for me at home which is so kind.‚Äô
Lana‚Äôs tanning obsession even saw her buy and ship a spray tan machine out to Italy for her destination wedding so she and some of her guests could have olive skin for her big day.
She started to notice the damage fake tanning products was doing to her dyed-blonde hair.
‚ÄòI was experiencing this awful yellow banding through my hairline. It took me a little while to figure out the reason was the tan,‚Äô she said.
‚ÄòI went online to see if there was a solution and there wasn‚Äôt which is just crazy to me.‚Äô
Lana started looking into the issue further and discovered tanning products not only cause discolouration to lighter hair but also damage and breakage.
‚ÄòDiscoloration is only a very small part of the problem. Even virgin hair is really badly damaged by fake tan,‚Äô she explained.
‚ÄòThe (hair) cuticles can become entirely cracked making the hair dry and rough. As soon as the cuticle is damaged everything can penetrate the hair and it becomes more porous.‚Äô
Before and after: Lana discovered tanning products can be as ‚Äòdamaging to hair as bleach‚Äô causing discolouration as well as breakage and dryness
In December Lana launched Auriche offering products that treat and protect hair from self-tan mousse, spray tan, or gradual tanning lotion
Tanning products come into contact with the hair around the back of the neck and on the mid-lengths and ends that touch the back and shoulders which is where the most damage is seen.
Lana said many self tanners think the wispy hairs on the back of their neck are ‚Äòbaby hairs‚Äô but they‚Äôre actually broken strands weakened by chemicals in tanning products.
The revelation of how bad tanning was for the hair set Lana on a path to create her own shampoo and conditioner specifically for those who love to use fake tan.
She spent months experimenting with different solutions on her kitchen bench while she had lot of free time during COVID lockdown before enlisting the help of a chemist to come up with an effective formula.
On December 1, after 18 months of researching and formulating, Lana launched Auriche offering products that treat and protect hair from self-tan mousse, spray tan, or gradual tanning lotion.
She created a range of products suited to tanners who either need to repair existing damage, prevent breakage from occurring and protect locks from chemicals in fake tanning products Lana said can be as harmful to the hair as bleach.

title: Cadenas de comida podr√°n servir en envases desechables hasta 2026 tras aprobarse pol√©mica ley
text:
Cadenas de comida podr√°n servir en envases desechables hasta 2026 tras aprobarse pol√©mica ley
En 2021 se aprob√≥ un proyecto de ley para limitar los pl√°sticos de un solo uso en Chile. Desde entonces, se estableci√≥ que el 13 de agosto de 2024 quedar√≠a prohibido el uso de envases desechables para consumo dentro de todos los locales de comida del pa√≠s.
Ahora, a seis d√≠as de que esa prohibici√≥n entrara en vigencia,
una ley presentada a fines de mayo y tramitada con urgencia modific√≥ la normativa para extender el uso de desechables hasta 2026. Esto en medio de denuncias de lobby por parte de cadenas de comida r√°pida como Mc Donald‚Äôs.
‚ÄúCon una celeridad que cualquier otro proyecto de ley querr√≠a, el poder legislativo, siguiendo la urgencia dada por el Gobierno, termin√≥ por ceder a las presiones. No exist√≠a ninguna raz√≥n para aplazar esta parte de la ley, sobre todo pensando en que se dio un plazo de tres a√±os para que los restaurantes y cadenas de comida r√°pida se adaptaran al cambio‚Äù, critic√≥ el director de campa√±as de la ONG Oc√©ana, Crist√≥bal Correa.
‚ÄúLos representantes del mundo empresarial que impulsaron este retraso ya han se√±alado p√∫blicamente sus √°nimos por cambiar la normativa. Sabemos, con todo el lobby que hay tras este cambio, que las cadenas internacionales de comida r√°pida usar√°n este tiempo extra para modificar la ley y que se les siga permitiendo la entrega de basura en sus restaurantes‚Äù, coment√≥ Correa.
Seg√∫n datos de la ONG, se calcula que una vez aplicada en su complitud, la ley de pl√°sticos implicar√≠a una reducci√≥n de al menos 23 mil toneladas por a√±o de desechos que se generan en los locales de alimentos.
Denuncias de lobby
Ya en junio, cuando avanzaba en el Congreso la ley que aplazaba la prohibici√≥n de envases desechables, una treintena de organizaciones denunciaron p√∫blicamente el lobby de cadenas multinacionales de comida r√°pida como Mc Donald‚Äôs, Burger King, Starbucks o KFC, que buscaba postergar la entrada en vigencia de la ley de pl√°sticos a trav√©s de parlamentarios.
Esto tambi√©n fue denunciado por los diputados Daniel Melo (PS) y F√©lix Gonz√°lez (IND), que llamaron al Gobierno y a la ministra de Medio Ambiente a reconsiderar su posici√≥n, luego de que el proyecto se aprobara en genera en la Comisi√≥n de Medio Ambiente de la C√°mara.
‚ÄúEl Gobierno, al poner discusi√≥n inmediata a este proyecto de ley, lo que hace en la pr√°ctica es hacerse parte y lo quiero decir as√≠, muy claro, es hacerse parte de manera c√≥mplice de los intereses de las grandes transnacionales de comida r√°pida como es Mc Donald‚Äôs‚Äù, declar√≥ en su momento Melo.
¬øDesechable es mejor que reutilizable?
En julio, un reportaje de Oceana denunci√≥ que Arcos Dorados, que opera Mc Donald‚Äôs en la regi√≥n, present√≥ un estudio que afirma que producir y usar envases reutilizables es m√°s da√±ino para el medio ambiente que seguir usando desechables, por la emisi√≥n de gases contaminantes y el uso de agua en su producci√≥n y lavado constante.
La denuncia de Oceana es que el estudio fue encargado por la Asociaci√≥n Chilena de Gastronom√≠a (ACHIGA), de la cual Mc Donald‚Äôs es parte. Adem√°s, describen una estrategia similar que us√≥ la cadena internacional en la Uni√≥n Europea cuando se discutieron leyes que prohib√≠an el uso de envases desechables.
Uso de agua
Antes del proyecto que busca aplazar la prohibici√≥n de envases desechables en el Congreso, se tramit√≥ y rechaz√≥ otro proyecto, presentado por senadores de derecha, que buscaba no aplazar sino suprimir por completo la prohibici√≥n.
La iniciativa fue rechazada por la Comisi√≥n de Recursos H√≠dricos del Senado, donde se escuch√≥ la experiencia de los titulares de Mall Plaza, que instalaron lavavajillas de alta eficiencia h√≠drica para que los locales de la plaza de comidas pudieran implementar de forma adelantada la medida.
Seg√∫n los datos recopilados por Mall Plaza y validados por el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente, el uso de envases desechables consume m√°s agua: mientras se necesitan 0,16 litros de agua para lavar un plato reutilizable, producir ese mismo plato pero hecho de material desechable ocupa 3,6 litros de agua, lo que significa un consumo h√≠drico 22 veces mayor.
Eso sin contar que por cada plato que se lava y reutiliza, se deber√≠an producir cientos de platos desechables que suplan el mismo uso. A los pocos d√≠as de que se rechazara el proyecto que suprim√≠a la prohibici√≥n de desechables, se present√≥ el que avanza ahora en el Congreso para aplazar su entrada en vigencia.

author: Felix Upton
title: Pro Wrestling World‚Äôs List of Notable Deaths in 2023
text:
[Felix Upton](/about-us/#felixupton)on December 28, 2023
The pro wrestling world is full of fascinating characters, and we sadly lost some beloved people in 2023. Although the pro wrestling world is extensive, and full of many stories on several levels, we have compiled a list of notable losses that the pro wrestling world saw in 2023.
There were some huge losses in 2023, like Bray Wyatt and Jay Briscoe‚Äôs tragic deaths. We also lost some absolute legends in 2023, like Terry Funk, Jerry Jarrett, and The Iron Sheik. It was truly a year full of sad headlines, but these names will never be forgotten for everything they gave to the world while they were with us.
Bray Wyatt passed away on August 24, 2023, at the age of 36. Known for his creative storytelling and terrifying gimmicks, Wyatt had a successful career, winning both the WWE Championship and Universal Championship. His last match was at the 2023 Royal Rumble, after which he was removed from television due to illness. Unfortunately, he succumbed to a heart attack following complications from COVID-19.
Terry Funk passed away on August 23, 2023, at the age of 79. A veteran of the wrestling industry, Funk had a career spanning over 50 years, making significant contributions to both WWE and WCW. Renowned for his hardcore style of wrestling, Funk retired from in-ring action in 2017. He had been battling dementia and lived an assisted life since 2021.
The Iron Sheik passed away on July 7, 2023, at the age of 81. An Iranian-American professional wrestler, he gained popularity in the 1980s and 1990s while wrestling for WWF and WCW. Inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame in 2005, The Iron Sheik had a memorable rivalry with Hulk Hogan.
Jay Briscoe tragically lost his life at the age of 38 on January 17th in a car accident in Delaware while accompanied by his daughters. The Delaware State Police reported that another woman driving a truck veered out of her lane for unknown reasons, resulting in a head-on collision with Briscoe‚Äôs truck. Unfortunately, Briscoe was not wearing a seatbelt at the time of the accident. Despite the devastating loss, Jay Briscoe leaves behind a legacy as a wrestling legend, having achieved significant success with his brother Mark, including holding the ROH World Tag Team Championship 13 times and earning recognition in various promotions. His wrestling journey began at the age of 16 in May 2000, and he and his brother, known as ‚ÄúDem Boyz,‚Äù made their mark in ROH in 2003. Reigning as the ROH Tag Champions at the time of his passing, they secured the titles from FTR at ROH Final Battle in 2022. Jay Briscoe also held the ROH World Championship twice as a singles competitor, and their contributions were honored with induction into the ROH Hall of Fame as part of the inaugural class in 2022.
Darren ‚ÄúDroz‚Äù Drozdov, who competed for WWF in the late 1990s, died on June 30, 2023, at AtlantiCare Regional Medical Center at the age of 54. Droz suffered a career-ending neck injury in 1999 but later continued as a writer for WWE.
Lanny Poffo passed away at the age of 68 on February 2 due to congestive heart failure, as announced by ‚ÄúHacksaw‚Äù Jim Duggan on Instagram, with the initial cause of death undisclosed. Poffo, also recognized as ‚ÄúLeaping‚Äù Lanny in the WWF, commenced his wrestling career in the 1970s, participating in various NWA promotions and International Championship Wrestling, initially owned by his father, Angelo Poffo. His tenure in the WWF spanned from 1985 to 1992, and he later joined his brother ‚ÄúMacho Man‚Äù Randy Savage in WCW during the mid-1990s, though he never had a televised match. Poffo‚Äôs final wrestling appearance occurred in January 2020 for Survival Championship Wrestling, and in 2020, he made a cameo on an episode of AEW during a tribute to Memphis wrestling legends. Beyond his in-ring persona as ‚ÄúThe Genius,‚Äù Poffo was recognized for his heel poetry and also for his literary contributions, including a biography comic book and an anti-smoking poetry book aimed at children.
Peggy Lee Flower, known by her ring names Peggy Lee Leather, Lady X, and Thug, passed away on May 22, 2023, at the age of 64. A former WWF Women‚Äôs Champion, she wrestled for multiple promotions and retired in 2013.
‚ÄúSuperstar‚Äù Billy Graham died on May 17, 2023, at the age of 79. Recognized for his time in WWWF/WWE, Graham held the WWWF Heavyweight Championship during the 1970s. He had been working with WWE under a legend contract since 2015 and faced health issues leading to his hospitalization in January 2023.
Jerry Jarrett, co-founder of NWA: TNA, died on February 14, 2023, at the age of 80. Known as a ‚ÄúWrestling Genius,‚Äù Jarrett contributed to multiple wrestling promotions and was associated with his son Jeff Jarrett.
Bushwhacker Butch passed away on April 2, 2023, in a Los Angeles hospital. He had traveled to participate in the WrestleMania 39 festival.
Mike ‚ÄúMantaur‚Äù Halac peacefully passed away in his sleep on July 11 at the age of 55, as reported by his daughter. According to her, Halac was relieved of pain after sustaining a back injury earlier in the day. Eric Simms of ESS Promotions also announced the news on social media, having booked Halac for an upcoming event. Halac gained prominence as Mantaur, a gimmick that fell flat during the WWF‚Äôs New Generation era, portraying a character billed as half-man and half-beast upon his debut in late 1994, briefly managed by Jim Cornette. After the gimmick was abandoned, he returned to the WWF as Tank in 1997 as part of The Truth Commission stable and also competed as Bruiser Mastino in ECW, making a solitary appearance in WCW in a dark match.
Absolute Andy passed away tragically in his sleep at the age of 40 on November 23. The announcement of his demise due to a prolonged battle with an undisclosed illness was made by the German promotion Westside Xtreme Wrestling (wXw), stating that he ‚Äúfell asleep in the presence of his wife.‚Äù Ullmann, a two-time GWP World Champion and five-time holder of wXw tag team gold, engaged in over 330 matches for the promotion. In 2020, he assumed the role of Director of Sports, wrestling his final match in January 2022 and relinquishing the wXw Shotgun Championship in March due to illness. Throughout his tenure, he faced notable opponents such as Bryan Danielson and GUNTHER, the latter expressing condolences on social media. Their last encounter occurred in the 30-man ShortCut to the Top match in 2019.
Our thoughts are with anyone who lost a loved one in 2023. This was a trying time for a lot of people, but now we can look forward to seeing what 2024 has to offer.
Please use the comments section to drop a tribute to someone we lost in 2023. This list is certainly full of outstanding talent that will be truly missed.

author: Julia Felton
title: Innamorato wants 500 affordable housing units in 500 days
text: Innamorato wants 500 affordable housing units in 500 days Pam Steimer was working two jobs when she was priced out of her Pittsburgh apartment 18 months ago. She moved into a hotel while she searched for a new place to live. But rent prices were ‚Äúout of my reach,‚Äù she said, and often required deposits equal to about three months of her salary. Steimer spent months living in the Second Avenue Commons homeless shelter Downtown ‚Äî it was placed out of commission this week by a fire ‚Äî before finding an apartment she could afford in Braddock, where she now feels secure. ‚ÄúUnfortunately, my struggles aren‚Äôt unusual,‚Äù Steimer said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want anyone else to experience what I did.‚Äù Steimer said a new initiative unveiled Thursday by Allegheny County Executive Sara Innamorato to house 500 people currently living in shelters gives her hope for others. Innamorato on Thursday announced a ‚Äúbold but achievable goal‚Äù of providing 500 units that will be affordable to the area‚Äôs lowest-income residents currently living in shelters. And she hopes to do it in 500 days. The goal, officials said in an announcement at the Allegheny County Courthouse, is to move people out of temporary shelters into permanent housing. That would provide people now staying in shelters with the chance to live in permanent, dignified housing, while also opening up shelter beds for those now sleeping on the streets. Innamorato is partnering with city, state and federal officials, landlords, philanthropic organizations and others to reach her goal. The effort could involve converting existing buildings like hotels or nursing homes; repairing apartments that are not currently in use; or identifying properties with landlords willing to partner on the project to make their housing affordable to people coming out of shelters. RK Mellon Foundation, the Hillman Foundation and the Heinz Endowments will each kick in $1 million. Eden Hall will contribute $375,000. And a government grant will add another $3 million. The program, officials said, will include support for both the people leaving shelter and their new landlords. Already, 75 housing units have been offered up for the initiative from Action Housing, Brandywine Communities and Rising Tide Partners, Innamorato said. For the county executive, housing issues are personal. She said she was 15 when she came home from school one day to the news from her mother that they were leaving their home. Innamorato lived in 10 different places from then until her high school graduation. ‚ÄúIt was a life of uncertainty, a life no one deserves,‚Äù she said. Data shows that Allegheny County‚Äôs homelessness has been on the rise. Last year, there was an average of 169 unsheltered people in Allegheny County, up from an average of 65 in 2021, according to the county‚Äôs Department of Human Services. People are staying longer in shelters and not migrating to more permanent housing, officials said, leading to more people on the street. County shelters have seen a 40% rise in length of stays. Likely driving that increase are what the county calls ‚Äúlow-risk‚Äù individuals such as Steimer. Those are people struggling economically who don‚Äôt qualify for special programs, who have less contact with mental health and criminal justice systems, and who have fewer issues with substance abuse. Many of them have jobs or some kind of income, but they don‚Äôt make enough to pay for housing, which has gotten more expensive in Allegheny County and across the country. County officials want to increase the flow in and out of shelters by making permanent affordable housing units available. They will start by providing those units to low-risk individuals. They make up about 75% of the people in shelters in Allegheny County. Though officials just announced the program, they‚Äôre already making progress in helping people transition from shelter into housing, said Erin Dalton, director of the county‚Äôs Department of Human Services. Last year, only a dozen people made the move to permanent public housing, Dalton said. Last month alone, 20 people made that jump. ‚ÄúWe know that housing‚Äôs about so much more than a roof and walls,‚Äù said U.S. Rep. Summer Lee, D-Swissvale, who joined Steimer, Innamorato and Dalton at the press conference. ‚ÄúIt plays a role in every aspect of our lives.‚Äù People shouldn‚Äôt have to pick between paying rent and putting food on the table, Lee said. The congresswoman is working to secure federal funding for the initiative. The Heinz Endowments intends to use its donation for a program at the former Vincentian de Marillac facility in Pittsburgh‚Äôs Stanton Heights neighborhood that would provide shelter and services for up to 56 people at a time for up to six months and would focus on helping people move into permanent housing. Julia Felton is a TribLive reporter covering Pittsburgh City Hall and other news in and around Pittsburgh. A La Roche University graduate, she joined the Trib in 2020. She can be reached at [jfelton@triblive.com](‚Äúmailto:jfelton@triblive.com‚Äù). title: Justo reconocimiento a dos sectores claves
text:
El personal de Salud P√∫blica se beneficiar√° de un aumento en los ingresos. Autor: Roberto Su√°rez Publicado: 28/12/2023 | 11:32 pm
Como parte de las proyecciones del Gobierno para corregir distorsiones y reimpulsar la econom√≠a, una de las decisiones de mayor impacto anunciadas recientemente en el 2do. Per√≠odo Ordinario de Sesiones de la Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular en su 10ma. Legislatura, est√° relacionada con el incremento de los ingresos y mejoras en la atenci√≥n al personal de los sectores de Educaci√≥n, Educaci√≥n Superior y Salud P√∫blica, pilares muy vinculados con la esencia misma de la Revoluci√≥n.
En tal sentido, la viceministra de Finanzas y Precios, Maritza Cruz Garc√≠a, explic√≥ este jueves en el espacio televisivo Mesa Redonda que se trata de dos sectores estrat√©gicos priorizados en todo momento desde el presupuesto del Estado, aun en las condiciones adversas que atravesamos.
Por ello para 2024, dijo, el 63 por ciento del gasto total del presupuesto estar√° dedicado a los sectores de salud, educaci√≥n, la asistencia y la seguridad social, cultura y deporte. En el caso de Salud P√∫blica, precis√≥, recibe un 26 por ciento del gasto total y la educaci√≥n un 20 por ciento.
Aunque no existe capacidad para un incremento masivo en todos los sectores, en espec√≠fico el Gobierno cubano decidi√≥ reconocer la Salud y la Educaci√≥n, aclar√≥, por la necesidad que tenemos de estabilizar la fuerza laboral especializada en esas esferas para mejorar la calidad de vida y de ense√±anza. Estamos hablando de m√°s de un mill√≥n de trabajadores entre ambas, asegur√≥.
La Viceministra de Finanzas y Precios record√≥ que esta es una medida parcial que incluye tambi√©n instituciones de la cultura y el deporte, al tiempo que coment√≥ que en la medida en que logremos generar mayores ingresos, el pa√≠s podr√° ampliar estos beneficios a otros sectores estrat√©gicos de la sociedad.
M√°s de 25 000 millones de pesos de incremento se erogar√°n para respaldar este gasto dentro del presupuesto. Por lo que Cruz Garc√≠a aclar√≥ que este paso requiere m√°s control para supervisar que el efecto de las medidas sea positivo, y que su dise√±o e implementaci√≥n sean los adecuados, para garantizar que se aseguren los recursos financieros necesarios.
M√°s motivaciones
El viceministro de Salud P√∫blica, Luis Fernando Navarro Mart√≠nez, detall√≥ que ese sector agrupa a m√°s de 409 000 trabajadores, y reconoci√≥ el esfuerzo del pa√≠s para respaldar desde el presupuesto del Estado todos los servicios de salud gratuitos.
En total son 22 medidas dispuestas, y de ellas cuatro resultan fundamentales por estar relacionadas con los ingresos de los trabajadores, sobre todo, aquellos profesionales y t√©cnicos vinculados directamente con los servicios m√©dicos.
Sobre el incremento salarial a los trabajadores que surtir√° efecto a partir del 1ro. de enero, consider√≥ que debe tener un impacto positivo en lo inmediato. La primera de estas medidas va encaminada al pago mensual por a√±os de servicio a m√©dicos, estomat√≥logos, personal de enfermer√≠a, sic√≥logos, tecn√≥logos y t√©cnicos.
Asimismo, signific√≥ que a partir de los 30 a√±os trabajados cada dos a√±os corresponde un incremento de 400 pesos mensuales. Esta justa recompensa para el personal con tiempo de antig√ºedad en el sector debe beneficiar a m√°s 212 000 trabajadores.
Adem√°s, aclar√≥, en el caso de los trabajadores de las universidades de Ciencias M√©dicas, recibir√°n el pago por servicio acorde con lo establecido por el Ministerio de Educaci√≥n Superior.
Entretanto, la segunda medida anunciada por el Viceministro de Salud P√∫blica es el incremento de la tarifa de las guardias nocturnas (horas trabajadas). En el caso del personal m√©dico y de estomatolog√≠a, la tarifa qued√≥ fijada en los 50 pesos la hora de lunes a viernes, desde las siete de la noche hasta las siete de la ma√±ana, mientras que los s√°bados se comienza a contar a partir del mediod√≠a, y los domingos desde las siete de la ma√±ana.
En el caso del personal de enfermer√≠a, refiri√≥, la tarifa es de 40 pesos la hora de siete de la noche a las siete de la ma√±ana, y para los tecn√≥logos de la salud resultar√° de 30 pesos tambi√©n por horas de trabajo en sus guardias nocturnas.
Para reconocer el esfuerzo de profesionales en condiciones especiales se aprob√≥ igualmente un pago adicional a m√©dicos, estomat√≥logos, personal de enfermer√≠a, sic√≥logos, tecn√≥logos, farmac√©uticos y otros profesionales t√©cnicos que trabajan directamente en los servicios de la salud de mayor demanda asistencial con un nivel importante de responsabilidad.
Para ello, seg√∫n explic√≥, se establecieron cinco grupos de condiciones especiales de trabajo, aplicables a m√©dicos y estomat√≥logos, que incluyen servicios brindados, desde la atenci√≥n primaria de salud hasta las m√°s complejas en la actividad secundaria y terciaria.
Los del primer grupo tienen tres pesos la hora, el segundo 4,50 pesos por hora, el tercero seis pesos por hora, el cuarto 7,80 y el quinto nueve pesos por hora. Para el personal de enfermer√≠a y otros t√©cnicos, las tarifas fueron fijadas para el primer grupo en 1,20 pesos por hora, el segundo en 2,30 pesos la hora y un tercer grupo en 3,50 pesos la hora. Precis√≥ el Viceministro que este pago se suma al de la escala salarial, los a√±os de antig√ºedad y las guardias nocturnas.
Mientras que una cuarta medida va encaminada al incremento de ingresos por carga docente, asistencial, investigativa y de otros servicios. O sea, hacia aquellos trabajadores que cubren, adem√°s de su puesto, otras plazas importantes. Para quienes est√©n en esta condici√≥n, inform√≥, la cuant√≠a m√°xima a pagar puede llegar a ser hasta de un ciento por ciento del salario escala del cargo que ocupa el trabajador.
El resto de las medidas del sector, coment√≥, se ir√°n implementando paulatinamente en 2024. Por su parte Santiago Abad√≠a, secretario general del Sindicato de Trabajadores de la Salud, precis√≥ que no se trata de una reforma salarial, sino de medidas que necesit√°bamos y que reclamaba nuestro pueblo y personal de salud.
Otro sector que se beneficia
Al igual que sucede en la Salud, para los docentes cubanos y personal de educaci√≥n, las medidas anunciadas en el Parlamento cubano se aprecian con una aceptaci√≥n general y de gran impacto, seg√∫n lo expresado en el espacio televisivo por la ministra de Educaci√≥n, Naima Ariatne Trujillo Barreto.
Dijo la Ministra que es este un programa integral y abarcador que se implementar√° en todos los niveles de Educaci√≥n, pues estamos hablando del sistema educacional m√°s amplio del pa√≠s. Todo ello ha exigido ajustar resoluciones e idear nuevos procedimientos. Todo lo que se va a hacer, asegur√≥, ha tenido una participaci√≥n y discusi√≥n, por lo que la ampliaci√≥n de estas disposiciones se ir√° realizando en la medida en que las condiciones del pa√≠s lo permitan.
Pero una de las medidas m√°s importantes para el sector radica en el pago adicional por antig√ºedad, que tiene como novedad que se involucra ahora tanto a trabajadores docentes como no docentes. Y con ello, subray√≥ Trujillo Barreto, se beneficiar√° de un modo u otro a 240 000 trabajadores del gremio. A√±adi√≥ que el rango de los 30 a√±os de trabajo es donde se encuentra el mayor n√∫mero de personal en este sector.
Para los profesores de las escuelas pedag√≥gicas y los IPVCE, habr√° igualmente un tratamiento diferenciado, aclar√≥. Asimismo, la remuneraci√≥n por sobrecarga docente fue abordada por la Ministra de Educaci√≥n, quien inform√≥ que ser√°n estimuladas personas que, adem√°s de cumplir con la actividad que normalmente corresponde a un docente de un nivel educativo, asumen condiciones especiales para cumplir con las labores que corresponder√≠a a un profesor que hoy no tenemos. Aqu√≠ tambi√©n se entiende a los trabajadores no docentes, agreg√≥, llegando en cualquier caso, hasta una retribuci√≥n del ciento por ciento del salario.
Por su parte, el Ministro de Educaci√≥n Superior, Walter Baluja Mart√≠nez, asever√≥ que la principal motivaci√≥n hasta hoy no ha sido el salario propiamente en estos sectores, de ah√≠ que las medidas sean tan relevantes e importantes.
En materia presupuestaria, coment√≥, m√°s del diez por ciento estar√° dedicado al pago por antig√ºedad del personal de la Educaci√≥n Superior. Tambi√©n est√° concebido, al igual que en la educaci√≥n general, el pago por la sobrecarga docente, en un sector donde ha crecido la matr√≠cula en los √∫ltimos a√±os.
Hay otras medidas, record√≥, que no se implementar√°n de inmediato y que tienen que ver con el pago de aquellos docentes que colaboran y realizan proyectos de car√°cter internacional. Adem√°s, al referirse a la estimulaci√≥n moral en la Educaci√≥n Superior, signific√≥ que es tambi√©n un aspecto importante, porque resulta una de las v√≠as m√°s relevantes para mantener reconocido a cada trabajador.

author: RK News
title: JK Press Corps urges PM to tackle unethical practices by some Mediapersons
text: Srinagar, Oct 24: The Jammu Kashmir Press Corps (JKPC) has raised concerns regarding certain individuals posing as editors and allegedly operating media organizations in Jammu and Kashmir (J&K). These individuals are reportedly engaged in defamation and blackmail, particularly targeting government officials, undermining efforts to promote transparency and fairness within the region‚Äôs press. ‚ÄúJournalists have been seen as custodians of public interest, bridging the gap between the government and the people. Their role in highlighting the issues faced by ordinary citizens and raising awareness about government initiatives aimed at public welfare is a cornerstone of democracy,‚Äù the statement said. However, in J&K, unethical practices have compromised the media‚Äôs integrity and the values it is meant to uphold. Before 2019, a select few media organizations in J&K monopolized the journalistic landscape, fostering radicalization and engaging in blackmail against various government departments, including the J&K Information Department. This unethical conduct severely damaged the integrity of journalism in the region, turning the media into a tool for personal gain rather than serving as a watchdog for society. Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi post-2019, significant reforms were introduced to rectify this situation. The media sector, particularly newspaper organizations, underwent a much-needed overhaul, restoring a sense of fairness and transparency in the distribution of government advertisements. The J&K Information Department ensured that all newspapers received their rightful share based on merit rather than coercion or manipulation. Recently, however, troubling reports have emerged suggesting that some of the same unscrupulous elements within the media fraternity are resorting to blackmail tactics once again. These individuals, often referred to as the ‚Äúblack sheep‚Äù of the newspaper community, are allegedly pressuring officials within the J&K Information Department. The actions of these individuals have not only tarnished the reputation of the entire journalistic community in Kashmir but have also turned their newspapers into tools for defamation and blackmail. They are accused of launching personal attacks against officials from various government departments, particularly those within the J&K Information Department, even going so far as to malign their private lives. Adding to the concern is the involvement of these so-called journalists and editors, some of whom are facing criminal charges and have been booked under the Public Safety Act (PSA). They are reportedly using their influence with newly elected legislators to further their own interests, undermining the transparency of government operations and harming both the personal and professional lives of their victims. This resurgence of unethical behavior has fostered a climate of fear, with innocent individuals being blackmailed under the guise of journalism. Many of these so-called ‚ÄúLitho newspapers‚Äù are printing only 50 to 100 copies to mislead the government. As the largest and only registered journalist association in J&K, the JKPC is deeply troubled by these developments. The organization urges the Prime Minister to take swift and decisive action against these blackmailers, emphasizing the need for accountability to prevent further degradation of the media‚Äôs credibility in J&K. Only through stringent measures can the press maintain its role as a force for truth and accountability rather than a tool for personal vendettas and corrupt practices. In response to these issues, the JKPC has resolved to send letters containing the names of alleged blackmailer editors and fraudulent media houses to the Prime Minister‚Äôs Office, the Home Minister‚Äôs Office, and the Chairperson of the Press Council of India.
